pros: - Supportive culture - Inspiring environment, lots of great staff and student ideas - Genuine feeling of being valued
cons: - Obvious lack of investment in some areas. Building I worked in needed some serious upgrading - had damp, roof leaks, drainage issues, lack of a staff kitchen.

job_title: Anonymous Temporary Employee in Hadlow, England
pros: Good experience for the CV and great with a good team
cons:
Depends on your team as it's mostly 16 year olds so if they are childish it can be the case of you do the work and they flaff around

Minimum wage

pros:
Friendly and knowledgeable, professional colleagues.
Large and beautiful campus.
cons:
Management is very top down driven and autocratic.
Support is superficial and first time lecturers are often dropped in with some very challenging students. Sink or swim.
Tick-box and walking inspections culture aimed to catch you out. 
Blame culture.
Technical skills of staff is not valued.
Paper work takes precedence.
Seminars are convoluted.

review_title: Was part of the arena party for the Kent County Show, the college hires students as crew members to set up the arenas
pros: My team was nice, got 1 lunch token for food
cons: Didn't have any real time to actually enjoy the show, when we was told being able to have time to look around is a big draw to the job
